These baselines include scope, cost and schedule baselines. Therefore, the junior project manager must store these procedures in the project management plan. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 88]

column2: During a weekly status meeting, a team member informs the project manager that the design submitted to the local government for approval has been rejected due to an error in the blueprint. Resubmission of the design will require an additional two weeks. What should the project manager do first?
column3: Review the reject submission and begin working on the resubmission
column4: Add another layer of review for future projects to avoid similar problems
column5: Inform the project sponsor and look for support
column6: Update the issue log and identify the possible cause of the error
column7: Resubmission of the design will require an additional two weeks this Is an issue and the project manager should FIRST update the issue log and identify the possible cause of the error. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 96]

column2: A project to develop a new product contains many stakeholders who are trying to influence the project but have conflicting interests. The project manager has just completed the project charter and is working on the project management plan, which only gives a high-level view of both the product specifications and the project scope. What should the project manager do next to build a detailed scope description?
column3: List all concerns in the stakeholder engagement plan
column4: Create the work breakdown structure. WBS
column5: Develop the scope statement with stakeholder input.
column6: Implement the plan scope management process.
column7: The project manager has only completed the project charter and now is working on planning. So the first process in the planning is plan scope management, that helps in know how to collect requirement , how to build a detailed scope description, how to create WBS, and how formal acceptance of the completed project deliverables will be obtained. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 137]

column2: During a risk audit, it was found that some risks were not analyzed correctly. It was suspected that risk-related information were not properly reviewed before concluding characteristics of risks like probability, etc. What could have been done to prevent this issue?
column4: Effective interviews during the risk identification process
column7: Risk data and quality assessment is about validating the accuracy and reliability of risk-related information. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 423]

column2: During the execution phase, a project manager discovers that team members have started to work on task that are coming directly from the customer. What should the project manager do?
column3: Split the project into two projects to keep the scopes separate and bill the client separately.
column4: Continue working on tasks that have already been started and revise the baseline
column5: Hold a risk review board meeting and add the tasks that have already been started to the risk log.
column6: Stop the work that is outside the project scope statement and submit a change request.
column7: The project manager should stop the work that is outside the project scope statement and submit a change request to take the approval from CCB, and only do the works included in the project scope statement or the approved change request. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 90]

column2: You are a project manager and have just assigned to the project in the execution phase. A project is in jeopardy. It is behind schedule and resources are limited. What is the first action you should take?
column7: When a project manager assign in the execution phase, the first action should be taken is Revise (Review) the project management plan. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 90]

column2: A project manager for a large, ongoing project is under a tight deadline to finish each of the project's three phases. The executives have decided to increase the budget and time to ensure their standards are met. The project manager has updated the schedule to reflect the increases. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Update the success criteria in the scope management plan.
column4: Review the requirements in the quality management plan.
column5: Add the tasks mentioned to the schedule management plan.
column6: Communicate the updated schedule to the stakeholder.
column7: The project manager has updated the schedule to reflect the new changes. The next step is communicate the updated schedule to the stakeholders. This is one of the change request steps. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 90]

column2: Your customer wants to remove certain attributes from the product. You submits a change request which is approved by the change control board ( CCB ). What should you do next?
column7: The project management plan should be updated after a change request takes approval by CCB. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.96]

column2: In the middle of the design phase of a software development project, the project manager realizes that planned tasks will be delivered late. What should the project manager do first?
column3: Revise the task delivery dates in the project management plan.
column4: Assume the delay, and report it during the next stakeholder meeting.
column5: Email stakeholders about the delay, and update the project management plan.
column7: It's an issue and the project manager should Update the issue log. The issue log will help the project manager effectively track and manage issues, ensuring that they are investigated and resolved. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 96]

column2: A project manager is running a complex transformation project. During a team briefing, the lead resource raises a concern that a critical milestone is being affected because tasks are taking longer than expected. What should the project manager do?
column3: Increase the number of resources to ensure that milestones are achieved
column4: Review the project management plan to identify how the estimates were built
column5: Inform the project sponsor of the expected delay and potential impact
column6: Identify corrective actions and raise the issue to the change control board CCB if needed
column7: Since the critical milestone is being affected because tasks are taking longer than expected. The project manager should Identify corrective actions and raise a change request to the change control board CCB if needed. Option (Increase the number of resources to ensure that milestones are achieved) is the next step after CCB approval. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 229]

column2: A project manager is executing a new office building. Which of the following activities might the project manager and the team conduct during the Monitor and Control Project Work process?
column3: Implementing approved change requests to achieve the project's objectives
column4: Transfer the ownership of deliverables to the assigned stakeholders
column5: Prepare and share the final project report according to the communications management plan
column6: Comparing actual project performance against the project management plan
column7: Monitor and Control Project Work is the process of tracking, reviewing, and reporting overall progress to meet the performance objectives defined in the project management plan. From the answers, only comparing actual project performance against the project management plan is performed during monitor and control project work process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 105]

column2: As a project manager, if you want to determine the best corrective action in terms of cost in case of project deviations, which of the following data analysis techniques should you use?
column7: The cost-benefit analysis helps to determine the best corrective action in terms of cost in case of project deviations. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 111]

column2: A stakeholder requests a change to the project. The project manager wants to avoid wasting the change control board (CCB) time and decides to approve the change themself. What should the project manager do to make sure they can approve this change?
column3: Request that all stakeholders vote before making a decision.
column4: Review the change with all stakeholders.
column5: Obtain the customer's approval before implementation.
column6: Verify that the change does not affect the project baseline.
column7:
Changes may or may not impact the project baselines. Sometimes only the performance against the baseline is affected. Decisions on those changes are usually made by
the project manager. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 117]

column2: After a project's first status meeting, the team realizes that the tasks are more complex than the project leader programmed . What should the project manager do to address this?
column3: Make changes to the original plan.
column4: Hire more people for the critical path.
column7: To address this situation, the project manager should Make changes to the original plan but FIRST he should Prepare a change request then analyze the impact on project constraints and get approval by CCB [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.96]

column2: Alan is a project manager, he joins a project that is involved with an industry in which he have little experience. An urgent issue is raised on the software development portion of the project. From whom should the project manager request direction?
column7: Since the project manager has little experience, the project manager should request direction from Internal subject matter experts that familiar with this portion of the project and industry. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.104]

column2: Which of the following soft skills helps to reduce misunderstandings and improves communication and knowledge sharing?
column7: Active listening helps reduce misunderstandings and improves communication and knowledge sharing. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 104]

column2: During the development of the scope management plan, a stakeholder requests the addition of pilot technology into the project scope to assist with the product marketing. What should the project manager do?
column3: Use the project reserve for the pilot technology.
column4: Review the scope baseline with the stakeholder.
column5: Increase the project budget with the cost of the pilot technology.
column6: Include the stakeholder in the scope planning meetings.
column7: The project manager should Include the stakeholder in the scope planning meetings. Note that meeting is one of the tools and techniques in the Plan Scope Management process to develop the Scope Management Plan. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 136]

column2: A project manager has just been assigned in the middle of the execution phase. The project is delayed and two important stakeholders are not cooperating with project objectives. Documentation states not to interact directly with either stakeholder, leaving this role to the company's chief information officer . What should the project manager do?
column3: Perform a root cause analysis and escalate to the two important stakeholders.
column4: Perform a data analysis and review the stakeholders' roles and responsibilities matrix.
column5: Perform a stakeholder analysis and escalate the issue to upper management.
column6: Perform an assumption and constraint analysis and review the stakeholder engagement plan.
column7: Analysis of current assumptions and constraints may be conducted in order to tailor appropriate engagement strategies. Review The stakeholder engagement plan that identifies the strategies and actions required to promote productive involvement of stakeholders in decision making and execution. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 521]

column2: Team members on a life cycle replacement project are consumed to frequently changing requirements even without formal approval. What should the project manager do?
column3: Review the cost baseline with team members, and ask that any changes to requirements with cost are captured
column4: Review the configuration management plan to identify what items will be changed and the frequency of the change
column5: Ask the project sponsor to provide directions to the project team with regard to the frequency of any changes to requirements
column6: Develop and implement a change management plan to define how changes will be addressed and controlled
column7: The change management plan is very important plan for every project because Its provide the direction for managing the change control process and documents the roles and responsibilities of the change control board (CCB). The project manager should develop and implement a change management plan to define how changes will be addressed and controlled. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 88]

column2: A project manager has completed his project on time and within budget. An unexpected complaint from a customer regarding the project's scope raised. It turns out that the customer wanted a much simpler solution. What should the project manager have done differently?
column3: Defined project scope with the customer.
column4: Controlled scope with the help of the project team.
column7: Since the project manager has almost completed a project, and the customer wanted a much simpler solution. This means that the project manager did not engage the customer as required and compiled all of his requirements. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 138]

column2: You have recently been assigned to manage a project that is midway into execution. The project is behind schedule and under budget, but the customer is not happy with the performance of the project. What is the FIRST thing you should do?
column5: Discuss it with the project team.
column7: First, you need to find out why the customer is not happy. Then meet with the team and determine options. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.95]

column2: You are managing the changes made to the scope baseline. The causes of variances and the corrective action chosen should be included in:
column7: The lessons learned register could be updated with techniques that are efficient and effective in controlling scope, including causes of variances and corrective actions chosen. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 171]

column2: Michel is managing a project. The project is about three-fourths done when the site engineer reports that due to inherent complexities in a specific task, the deliverables would be delayed. This would involve additional analysis and then implementation. He requests that this new work be added to the scope and also the time required to be added to the schedule. You and the site engineer have analyzed the impact of this change to cost, and have written up a change request and requested approval from the change control board. Just today, you have received approval from the change control board - what should be the immediate course of action?
column4: Ascertain the impact of this change to scope, schedule and cost before making any change
column6: Make sure that the scope baseline and schedule baseline are updated to reflect the approved change before implementing the change.
column7:
Direct and Manage Project Work is the process of leading and performing the work defined in the project management
plan and implementing approved changes to achieve the project?s objectives. The key benefit of this process is that it
provides overall management of the project work and deliverables, thus improving the probability of project success. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.90]

column2: A project's primary focus is on schedule. To monitor this, the project manager requests monthly progress reports from the contractor. What should the project manager ask the contractor to include in these reports?
column7: The project manager should ask the contractor to include Gantt charts or also known as Bar charts in these reports because its represent schedule information where activities are listed on the vertical axis, dates are shown on the horizontal axis, and activity durations are shown as horizontal bars placed according to start and finish dates. Gantt or Bar charts are relatively easy to read and are commonly used. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 217]

column2: You have been hired as a project manager for a new project. After several weeks, you discover that the accounting department has declined all charges because the project was not approved. What should the project manager have done to prevent this?
column3: Planned the resources necessary to start the project
column4: Verified that the business case was authorized by the project initiator
column5: Obtained the fund needed to start the project
column6: Obtained the project charter approval from the project sponsor
column7: The sponsor or initiator of the project Is responsible to establish (approve and issue) the charter and can take the help of the prospect project manager to develop it. The project manager should obtain the project charter approval from the project sponsor because the project charter is a document that formally authorizes the existence of a project al d provides the project manager with the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 75]

column2: A recently appointed project manager is in constant conflict with a senior manager. Since this is not ideal for the team, the project manager wants to resolve this. What should the project manager do?
column3: Escalate the issue to the project sponsor.
column4: Seek guidance from the other project managers.
column5: Enlist the help of a neutral mediator.
column6: Request a scheduled face-to-face meetings with the senior manager.
column7: The project manager should request scheduled face-to-face meetings with the senior manager. This is an example of problem solving technique (The best Conflict Resolutions technique).  [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 356]

column2: After defining project goals and objectives. The PMO conducts a meeting with stakeholders to align expectations. What result indicates that the project is moving forward correctly?
column7: Identify key deliverables based on the business requirements in order to manage customer expectations and direct the achievement of project goals. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.95]

column2: Your project is currently in the execution phase. The team members have been implemented a change request without going through the CCB. As a project manager, what should you do?
column6: Send the change request to CCB for approval
column7: Since the team members implemented a change request without through the CCB, as a project manager you should send the change to CCB for approval.. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.96]

column2: You are working with your team on estimating how much time each activity will take. One of the documents you are using contains information on categories of labor, material, and equipment required to complete your project. You are also interested to see skill levels of your labor, any certifications required, and grade levels your supplies. Which of the following documents would you primarily refer to for this purpose?
column7: Based on the scenario described, the project team is performing the Estimate Activity Durations process. An input to this process is the Resource Breakdown Structure (RBS) which is a hierarchical list of team and physical resources related by category and resource type that is used for planning, managing. and controlling project work. Each descending level represents an increasingly detailed description of the resource until the information is a small enough to be used in conjunction with the WBS to allow the work to be planned, monitored, and controlled. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 198]

column2: You are preparing two documents for risk management. One contains sources of overall project risk and also summary information on individual risks. The second describes individual risks identified. What name should you give to the first document?
column7: The risk report presents the current level of overall risk exposure of the project that will inform the selection of the risk response strategy. The risk report may also list individual project risks in priority order and provide additional analysis of the distribution of individual project risks that may inform risk response selection. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 440]

column2: The mitigation plan is failed to deal with the issue that occurred three weeks ago because of unavailable resources,  and has negatively impacted the schedule. What should the project manager have done to prevent this?
column3: Sent out status reports to stakeholders.
column6: Conducted stand-up meetings to communicate project status.
column7: To avoid this situation, the project manager should have done conducted review meetings to communicate project status to stakeholders periodically. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.95]

column2: You are a Project manager developing the project charter. Which of the Following are you using in this Process?
column7: Agreements are used to define initial intentions for a project. Agreements may take the form of contracts, memorandums of understanding (MOUs), service level agreements (SLA), letters of agreement, letters of intent, verbal agreements, email, or other written agreements. Typically, a contract is used when a project is being performed for an external customer. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page78 ]

column2: During project execution, it is noticed that the actual expenditure is too high compared to baseline cost estimates. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Revisit project scope and cut high-cost items.
column4: Review historical data to get new cost estimates.
column5: Review assumption log to understand which cost assumptions were wrong.
column6: Update cost forecasts and discuss the options with the project sponsor.
column7: Because the actual expenditure is too high compared to baseline cost estimates, the project manager should update cost forecasts and discuss the options with the project sponsor.  [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 269]

column2: A project manager needs to communicate the start of the project, key milestones, and other relevant information to stakeholders, and then gain their commitment. What should the project manager do?
column3: Review and assess detailed project requirements, constraints, and assumptions with stakeholders.
column7: The project kick-off meeting is usually associated with the end of planning and the start of executing. It's purpose is to communicate the objectives of the project, gain the commitment of the team for the project, and explain the roles and responsibilities of each stakeholder. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 86]

column2: During project closure and transferring of the completed project deliverables to the operation department, the project manager discovers that an audit report from an early project phase is missing. What should the project manager do?
column3: Remove the audit report from the required project documents and update the project management plan.
column4: Ask the operation department representative to accept the project without the audit report.
column5: Complete project closure and update the OPA
column6: Inform the operation department representative about the missing audit report.
column7: Ethically, the project manager must Inform the operation department representative about the missing audit report. [PMBOK 6th edition. Page 121]

column2: One of the project risks is likely to cause, a negative impact of SAR 15,000 with a probability of 50%. At the same time, there is a possibility of saving SAR 10,000 by choosing alternate resources, this has a likelihood of 25%. What is the Expected Monetary Value (EMV) of the project?
column7:
The Expected Monetary Value (EMV) of risks in the project is the sum of the probability multiplied by impact for each risk. Threats will have negative impact and opportunities will have positive impact. 
So, EMV = (Probability * Impact) for each Risk 
                = - (0.5*15,000) + (0.25*10,000) = SAR -5,000.
[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 435]

column2: A project manager has been hired to develop a product for a multinational company. While writing the key deliverables for the project charter, the project manager has two technology options and is unsure of which to use. One is safer and the other is cheaper. What should the project manager do to determine the key deliverables for the project?
column3: Establish requirements with the project sponsor.
column4: Use the cheaper technology in order to maintain the budget.
column5: Choose the best option based on the project manager's experience.
column6: Meet with the client to understand their technological requirements.
column7: Refer to PMP exam content outline in Initiating (Task 02). Project Manager have to Identify key deliverables based on the business requirements in order to manage customer expectations and direct the achievement of project goals. So, the correct answer Is to meet with the client to understand their technological requirements.

column2: You have been assigned as a project manager of a new project to be executed out of Orlando. The project is being implemented in an area with many hurricanes. What is the best risk response strategy appropriate for this project?
column7: The best risk response strategy appropriate for this project, hire a third party to complete this work and shifting ownership of a threat to a third party to manage the risk and to bear the impact if the threat occurs. [PMBOK 6th edition, page 443]

column2: A project earned value = SAR 40,000 , Actual Cost = SAR 50,000 , and BAC = SAR 200,000. What is the Estimate To Complete (ETC) for the project if the work is performed at the budgeted rate?
column7:
The Formula used for EAC is 
EAC = AC + BAC - EV 
        = 50,000 + 200,000 - 40,000 = SAR 210,000
ETC = EAC - AC 
        = 210,000 - 50,000 = SAR 160,000
[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

column2: A project manager has just completed the project management plan for a construction project. This is a high-visibility project for many stakeholders across multiple functional departments and level of understanding. What can the project manager do to ensure approval of the project management plan?
column3: Develop a stakeholder register and then select the most important stakeholder to obtain their approval.
column4: Ask the project sponsor to approve the project management plan as a first step, then communicate this to other stakeholders to help approve the project .
column5: Conduct interviews with each stakeholders separately in order to obtain approval of the project management plan individually.
column6: Organize a meeting for stakeholders and provide the appropriate information to obtain their approval.
column7: Refer to PMP exam content outline in the planning (Task no. 11). Present the project management plan to the relevant stakeholders according to applicable policies and procedures in order to obtain approval to proceed with project execution. So the correct answer is: Organize a meeting for stakeholders and provide the appropriate information to obtain their approval. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 86]

column2: A project manager is managing a project to build a telecommunications tower. The project requires a crane, but the crane previously booked for this project receives a last-minute reassignment to a higher-priority government project. What should the project manager do first?
column3: Review the service agreement with the vendor.
column6: Add this to the issue log.
column7:
The first action to do by project manager is to add this issue to the issue log. Then prepare resolution for the situation. 
Hint: If the question ask "what is the best course of action", then the best answer is prepare resolution for the situation. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 358]

column2: A project manager is currently developing the project schedule for a mandatory regulatory project. The project manager is receiving input from different stakeholders and finds that many of them are estimating completion times that are longer than the established end date. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Apply crashing to the project management plan in order to reduce the extension of the proposed schedule.
column4: Remind the stakeholders about the project constraints and request a revision of their inputs.
column5: Identify a new critical path that could guarantee the project's completion by the end date.
column6: Notify the sponsor and request to modify the end date to accommodate the proposed schedule.
column7: Since the stakeholders inputs will impact the established end date, the project manager should FIRST Notify the sponsor and request to modify the end date to accommodate the proposed schedule. The option (Remind the stakeholders about the project constraints and request a revision of their inputs) may be the next step if the project sponsor refuse to modify the end date. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 205]

column2: The project manager had been appointed recently in marketing Project. A team member informs you with a serious concern that impacts the project. You start to record the details, identifies an owner, and sets a realistic date for resolution. What document did the project manager update?
column7: The issue log will help the project manager effectively track and manage issues, ensuring that they are investigated and resolved [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 96]

column2: Rework is an example of?
column7: The cost of quality (COQ) associated with a project consists of Prevention costs, Appraisal costs and Failure costs (internal/external). Rework is an example of Internal Failure Costs [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 282, 283]

column2: During a project status meeting, a team member informs the project manager of an unexpected increase in the price of an essential component required to complete the deliverable. What should the project manager do?
column3: Include the increased price in the project budget.
column4: Refer to the procurement management plan.
column5: Update the risk management plan to adapt to the new scenario.
column6: Analyze the impact of the price increase on the project.
column7: Analyze the impact of the price Increase on the project. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 257]

column2: While controlling project work, the team discovers that the schedule performance index (SPI) is 0.8 and the cost performance index (CPI) is 0.95 . If the schedule for this project is a priority and no additional resources are available, what should the project manager do?
column7: Since (The schedule is a priority & No additional resources are available & The schedule performance index (SPI) is .8 & the cost performance index (CPI) is .95). This mean that the project is behind schedule and over budget. So the project manager should use fast tracking as there is no additional resources are available to use crashing. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 215]

column2: A resources can't be retained for the full project life cycle and there is no additional budget available. What should the project manager do to ensure effective project delivery while utilizing resources within budgeted limits?
column3: Move budgeted funds from other project areas to mitigate any risk of gaps in assignments.
column4: Create a budget change request for stakeholders before presenting project progress.
column5: Identify those resources who can likely perform all necessary project tasks, and remove resources that are specialized.
column6: Schedule similar tasks around the same time to limit the duration of resources' engagement.
column7: Because of the resources can't be retained for the full project life cycle and there is no additional budget available, the project manager should Schedule similar tasks around the same time to limit the duration of resources' engagement to ensure effective project delivery within budgeted limits. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.211]

column2: Which of the following technique can be used to identify the key issues and suitable alternatives to be prioritized as a set of decisions for implementation?
column7: Prioritization matrix can be used to identify the key issues and suitable alternatives to be prioritized as a set of decisions for implementation. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 283]

column2: Which of the following techniques can ensure that the stakeholders are engaged at appropriate project phases and to obtain or confirm their continued commitment to the success of the project?
column7: Stage-gate or phase review meetings give to project stakeholders a chance to review project progress and planned future actions. This gives them a chance to have their voice heard and recorded. The rest of the choices are techniques that are internal to a project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 21]

column2: In a construction project, concrete is unable to be used because heavy rain affected its consistency. This possibility and its estimated costs were already identified in the risk register. How should the project manager fund the additional costs?
column7: Keyword ( already identified in the risk register ) ... Contingency reserves are the budget within the cost baseline that is allocated for identified risks. Contingency reserves are often viewed as part of the budget intended to address the known unknowns that can affect4 a project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 245]

column2: You have recently been assigned as the project manager for a company that has a history of implementing system integration projects and you don't have prior experience. What should you do?
column5: Refer to the project statement of work (SOW).
column7: keyword ( you don't have prior experience ) so the project manager should seek expert judgment. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 94]

column2: A long term project for a company that is increasing its infrastructure is running . In month 13 of the project, the client escalates an issue that an expected delivery from a contracted third-party vendor wasn't received. Upon investigation, the project manager discovers that the vendor was unaware of this. Where should the project manager verify the delivery schedule?
column7: A milestone is a significant point or event in a project. A milestone list identifies all project milestones and indicates whether the milestone is mandatory, such as those required by contract, or optional, such as those based on historical information. Milestones have zero duration because they represent a significant point or event. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 186]

column2: A stakeholder refuses to accept delivery of a project that has passed the acceptance criteria, and provides a new set of acceptance criteria. What should the project manager do to enable project completion?
column3: Escalate the issue to the stakeholder's manager.
column4: Rework the project deliverables to meet the new acceptance criteria.
column5: Execute the change control process to accommodate the new acceptance criteria.
column6: Negotiate with the stakeholder to accept the project in its current state.
column7: Since the deliverable of the project has passed the acceptance criteria, therefore the project manager should first negotiate with the stakeholder to accept the project in its current state within the existing acceptance criteria before any change or escalation. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 163]

column2: There are several communication methods used to share and distribute information to stakeholders, team members, and management. Which of the following communication methods is used when you notify the public about environmental effects from your project after implementation by posting reports on the project's website?
column7: Push communication is used to send information to specific recipients who need to know. Push communication is done using letters, faxes, memos, etc. Pull communication is used for large volumes of information. The methods for this type of communication include internet sites and blogs. Since you want to notify the general public about environmental effects by posting reports on the project's website, this is an example of pull communication methods. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 374]

column2: You are a project manager constructing a new railway. The rainy season in the area prevents on-site work for three months of each year. In which of the following should this information be documented initially?
column7: Since the project manager is aware of the rainy season will happen on a yearly basis, therefore it should be recorded in the project charter. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.81]

column2: A project manager joins a new project for an organization that does not have a lessons learned repository. How should the project manager establish the project baselines?
column3: Identify and map the benefits and outcomes of the project.
column4: Ask stakeholders to provide their recommendations for the project.
column5: Develop a business case to document project objectives.
column6: Perform a data gathering analysis and review the organizational process assets
column7: Since he is a new project manager, he should perform a data gathering analysis and review the organizational process assets to establish the project baseline. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 82]

column2: The project manager is in the initiation phase of his project. What area should he consider when developing the business case?
column4: Expected resource performance to the strategic portfolio objectives.
column5: Expected resource performance and cost-benefit analysis
column6: Business benefits and the organizational strategy.

Conduct benefit analysis with relevant stakeholders to validate project alignment with organizational strategy and expected business value. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.29]

column2: Sony is so good at assembling those types of equipment, that if someone with no experience is hired, it would take two years to match his skill. This type of knowledge is known as:
column7: Knowledge is commonly split into "explicit" (knowledge that can be readily codified using words, pictures, and numbers) and "tacit" (knowledge that i: personal and difficult to express, such as beliefs, insights, experience, and "know-how").. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 100]

column2: You are managing a project that requires an environmental permit to do work. The approval is in the final stages when a confidential, reliable report is brought to your notice. The report indicates there is a high risk of an environmental hazard due to the project. Your manager tells you it is better to keep quiet at this stage since losses from terminating the project might be very high. You must:
column3: Send an email to your manager documenting the matter and disclaimer ownership of the project.
column4: Wait for the project to start and see if the information in the report is true.
column5: Keep quiet about the matter since you will follow your man instructions.
column6: Inform the necessary authorities of the hazard, even if it means canceled the project.

column2: You have managed a federal highway construction project, which is intended to improve transportation between north and south regions of the country. In the execution phase, you received many complaints from stakeholders, including the highway transportation agency. At least half these complaints were regarding the quality of the micro texture of the road, and the nonconformance to the quality levels incorporated in the project quality management plan. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 485].

column2: You are a project manager in the telecom project for your organization. Due to the lateness of workers' payments, the workers made a strike, causing delays in an important component delivery. What could have been done differently to prevent this type of situation?

A schedule network analysis is performed using the schedule to compute the different scenarios, such as delaying a major component delivery, extending specific engineering durations, or introducing external factors, such as a strike or a change in the permit process. The outcome of the what-if scenario analysis can be used to assess the feasibility of the project schedule under different conditions, and in preparing schedule reserves and response plans to address the impact of unexpected situations. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 213]

Resource leveling can be used when
shared or critically required resources are available only at certain times or in limited quantities, or are over allocated,

[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 413]

column2: A project manager has two projects of equal strategic importance. However, due to budget constraints, only one can be keep ongoing. column7: Decision trees analysis are used to support selection of the best of several alternative courses of action. Alternative paths through the project are shown in the decision tree using branches representing different decisions or events, each of which can have associated costs and related individual project risks (including both threats and opportunities). The end-points of branches in the decision tree represent the outcome from following that particular path, which can be negative or positive. The decision tree is evaluated by calculating the expected monetary value of each branch, allowing the optimal path to be selected. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 435]

column2: All the following activities are performed in the Close Project or Phase process except:
column3: Activities that fulfill the exit criteria of the project

[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 198]

column2: Your CEO asked you what the Estimate at Completion (EAC) will be for a small project you are working on. column2: You have been appointed as a project manager for a project which involves more than 2,000 stakeholders. column7:
A power/interest grid is a classification model used for stakeholder analysis and management that groups the stakeholders based on their level of authority (power) and their level of concern (interest) regarding project outcomes. The classification and recommended management strategies are as follows: 
Low-power/low-interest: monitor only 
Low-power/high-interest: keep informed 
High-power/low-interest: keep satisfied 
High-power/high-interest: manage closely

column5: Remove the supplier from your project.
column7: Performance reviews for contracts measure, compare and analyze quality, resource, schedule, and cost performance against the agreement. This includes identifying work packages that are ahead or behind schedule, over or under budget or have resource or quality issues. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 498]

column2: A techniques help to identify and analyze risks. Which of below?
column7: Expert Judgment is T&T in all Risk processes expect Monitor Risk. [PMBOK 6th edition. Page 396]

column2: The project charter has been signed, and a project management plan is in place. What should you as the project manager do next?
column7: The project charter has been signed and the project management plan is in place, this mean that the initiating and planning phase is finished and the next process is the execution phase. So, Assign the project team is the Correct answer. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.328]

column2: Which of the following analysis techniques is recommended when you need to analyze project stakeholders based on their power, urgency, and legitimacy and usefulness for large complex communities of stakeholders or where there are complex networks of relationships within the community?
column7: Salience model. Describes classes of stakeholders based on assessments of their power (level of authority or ability to influence the outcomes of the project), urgency (need for immediate attention, either time-constrained or relating to the stakeholders' high stake in the outcome), and legitimacy (their involvement is appropriate). There is an adaptation of the salience model that substitutes proximity for legitimacy (applying to the team and measuring their level of involvement with the work of the project). The salience model is useful for large complex communities of stakeholders or where there are complex networks of relationships within the community. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 513]

column2: The customer comes to you during the project execution and tells you about a minor requirement that he forgot during the collect requirement process. He assures you that there will be no effect on the cost if you implement his request. What will your next step be?
column6: Evaluate the impact with team members
column7: You should first evaluate the impact of the change with the team member then inform the customer of the impact on project constraints. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.622]

column2: The customer sent an urgent change request. You review the request and find that it might cost a lot if you implement this change request. What will be your next step?
column4: You will not allow any change request
column5: Since it increases the cost, reject it
column6: Discuss the cost impact with the client
column7: You should discuss the impact of the change request on the project cost with the client. You cannot process the change request unless the client agrees with its impact on any project objective. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.257]

column2: During the team review, the project manager learns that the schedule performance index (SPI) is 0.6 and the cost performance index (CPI) is 0.8. The project manager asks team members to work overtime. How will this effect the ( CPI ) ?
column7: (SPI) is 0.6 and ( CPI ) is 0.8 it's mean that the project is behind schedule and over budget. So the added overtime will increase the actual cost (AC) so the CPI will decreases.  [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

column2: You identify that three leaders in the organization have three different expectations about what should be implemented in a project. What did you use to identify this?
column7: Stakeholder analysis results in a list of stakeholders and relevant information such as their positions in the organization, roles on the project, expectations, attitudes (their levels of support for the project), and their interest in information about the project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page, 512]

column2: During the execution phase. A risk management plan has been implemented and risk analysis is ongoing. How should the impacts of identified risks be communicated to the stakeholder?
column3: Show the reasons for upcoming risks using either an affinity diagram or a matrix diagram.
column4: Engage in opportunity management on the identified risks for added value.
column5: Calculate the necessary contingency funding and time buffers needed for the risk response.
column6: Draw a probability and impact matrix to prioritize risks.
column7: Draw a probability and impact matrix or a hierarchical chart to prioritize risks to communicate the impacts of identified risks to the stakeholder. A probability and impact matrix is a grid for mapping the probability of each risk occurrence and its impact on project objectives if that risk occurs. Hierarchical charts. Where risks have been categorized using more than two parameters, the probability and impact matrix cannot be used and other graphical representations are required [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 425]

column2: A project manager leading constructing dams and must provide cost estimates to stakeholders. What should the project manager present to avoid unreasonable cuts in the budget that will undermine the project?
column4: Cost estimates as per historical data and other variables.
column6: Bottom-up cost as the basis for the estimate.
column7: Bottom-up estimating is a method of estimating a component of work. The cost of individual work packages or activities is estimated to the greatest level of specified detail.[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 244]

column2: What is the key purpose of the Monitoring and Controlling process group?
column3: Perform preventive actions so that no variances ever occur in the project lifecycle
column6: Measure project performance in order to identify and quantify any variances and perform approved corrective actions
column7: Measure project performance in order to identify and quantify any variances and perform approved corrective actions. Preventive actions should be identified and implemented during this process group but they will not ensure that variances won't take place throughout the project lifecycle. Only conducting daily status meetings will not assist in monitoring and controlling the project. Refer to PMP Exam Outline in the Monitoring and Controlling Process Group ( Task no 1 )

column2: You are working on a project to construct four buildings complex. The project management plan calls for completion of one building per year at a cost of US$ 100 Million each. At the end of year three, 1st Building was completed at a cost of US$100 million & 2nd Building completed at a cost of US$120 million & 3rd Building only 50% completed at a cost of US$ 60 million To meet the original project management plan, what monthly performance is needed until the end of year four?
column7: Here he ask to calculate the TCPI , to meet the original project management plan you should use the equation TCPI= (BAC-EV) / (BAC-AC) ....... BAC= 4'100 M = 400 M & AC= 100 M+ 120M + 60M = 280 M & EV= 2.5/4 X 400 M =250 M So the TCPI= (BAC-EV) / (BAC-AC) ( 400 M -250 M ) / ( 400 M - 280 M ) = 1.25 = 125 %. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

column2: You are a project manager in a infrastructure project. During a review, the project team member identifies a quality issue that may cause the product to be rejected by the customer. However, the project sponsor wants to deliver the product. As a project manager, what should you do?
column3: Ensure that the product meets customer requirements.
column7: The Quality issue may or may not cause the product to be rejected by the customer. SO, the project manager should first Review the quality checklist. Quality checklist used to verify that a set of required steps has been performed or to check if a list of requirements has been satisfied. Quality checklists should incorporate the acceptance criteria included in the scope baseline. After reviewing the Quality checklist by the project manager and verifying the existence of an issue, the issue must then be presented to the customer and if he not accept the product then it must be recorded in the issue log to start track and find the solution. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 292, 302]

column2: Your project has been progressing well so far. Due to an unexpected increase in the cost of raw materials which was not factored as project risk, you are in need of some management reserve. The management reserve is available but the sponsor asks you to do something to obtain it. What is the sponsor asking you to do?
column3: There is no need for a management reserve as the risk was not factored, and therefore it may be funded from the contingency reserve
column4: To put in a request to the sponsor for the management reserve
column5: To first move the required funds from the contingency reserve to the management reserve
column6: To follow the change approval process to move the required management reserve funds to the cost baseline
column7: A standard procedure in such a situation is to obtain change approval to move the required funds from the management reserve to the cost baseline and then use that amount from the cost baseline. All other options are incorrect. Putting in a request to the sponsor has already been done. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 269]

column2: You have just been assigned as the project manager of a project to construct a hospital. During a planning meeting, the team decides to conduct a site survey to determine the ground conditions before engineering the design. Which of the following risk management processes is the team implementing?
column7: The project team is implementing the Identify Risks process to identify the risks that may impact the project before engineering the design. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.409]

column2: A new resource has been assigned to a project team. He used to a different delivery method that is less productive and does not enforce deadline. The new delivery method is integrated so low productivity personnel have larger impact on the overall productivity of team performance. What strategy can the project manager apply to resolve the conflict with the new resource?
column7: Collaborate/problem solve is the best conflict resolution technique to resolve the conflict with the new resource. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 349]

column2: You are managing very complex project and due to a scope change, you need a few additional experts, which you did not think of earlier. You request that your company provide you with some experts for consultancy work. Although your company has provided you with those experts, they are located in a different geographical location. In this situation, how will you get their input?
column4: Recruit new members with same skills
column5: Ask management to bring them to you
column7: If your experts are located in different geographical locations and you need their input, you will create a virtual team including all these experts [PMBOK 6th edition, Page333]

column2: During having a coffee with the CEO that you have a good relationship with, he was surprised that you do not have the information that your project will be canceled due to future changes in company plans, and your team members will be released. As a Project manager, what should you do?
column3: Hold a meeting with your team and inform them about what will happen.
column4: Hold a meeting with stakeholders and discuss this information openly with them
column5: Hold a meeting with the sponsor and discuss this info with him.
column6: Review the communication management plan and validate why you did not get this information through it.
column7: The PM should Review the communication management plan because this plan contains the Information to be communicated and the Person or groups who will receive the information. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377]

column2: A key stakeholder has removed a key team resource from a project. The activities on the critical path will be negatively affected by this action. What should the project manager do?
column3: Analyze the impact to the project management plan and submit a change request.
column4: Engage the sponsor to discuss the importance of the resource with the functional leader.
column5: Negotiate with and influence the functional leader to reverse their decision.
column6: Acquire a replacement resource by following the resource management plan.
column7: There is no benefit from the Negotiation with the functional leader to reverse their decision. Not good practice to Engage the sponsor as a first step. The project manager should Acquire a replacement resource by following the resource management plan because the critical path will be negatively affected by this action. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.330]

column2: You are in the first meetings for your new project that you have been assigned to, two team members were discussing new ideas that each one thinks is correct and their opinion is the best for the project. You didn't interact or cut the discussion, as you know this is a normal discussion in this phase, which is?
column7: Storming. During this phase, the team begins to address the project work, technical decisions, and the project management approach. if team members are not collaborative or open to differing ideas and perspectives, the environment can become counterproductive. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 338]

column2: As a project manager, in which document will you find information about the acceptable level of project and product quality and how to ensure this level of quality in its deliverables and processes?
column7: The acceptable level of project and product quality and how to ensure this level of quality in its deliverables and processes are part of the information in the project management plan as it includes the quality management plan as one of its components, so, option (The project management plan) is the right answer. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 286]

column2: You are managing a project with a budget of 9,000, and 1,500 has been spent. However, you only completed $1000 worth of work. Your schedule says that you should have completed 50% of the work. What is the estimate at completion (EAC)?
column3: US$ 9000 ( Based on original project Budget )
column5: US$13500 ( Based on original project Budget )
column7: The most common formula for EAC is BAC/CPI. CPI=EV/AC =1000/1500= 0.66 So, EAC=9000/0.66 =13500. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

column2: On a virtual project status meeting, there is a team member who consistently has issues with the technology being used to join the meeting. These issues are preventing this team member from being actively engaged in the meetings. What should the project manager do?
column3: Ask another team member to follow up and provide updates to the team member.
column4: Call this team member separately to communicate the project status.
column5: Replace the team member with someone who has more technology experience.
column6: Have a separate meeting with the team member to find a solution together.
column7: The project manager should have a separate meeting with the team member to find a solution together because these issues are preventing this team member from being actively engaged in the meetings. This is an example of solve problem technique. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.356]

column2: On your project, two team members often disagree. You need a long-term conflict resolution method. You decide to use which one of the following approaches?
column7: ( Problem-solving ) which provides a long-term resolution. Collaborate/problem solve. Incorporating multiple viewpoints and insights from differing perspectives; requires a cooperative attitude and open dialogue that typically leads to consensus and commitment. This approach can result in a win-win situation. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 349]

column2: During the execution of the project, you had to manage a change request. You evaluated the impact of the change on the other constraints of the project, then you got the change request approved by CCB. The next step a project manager should do is:
column4: Inform stakeholders with new status of the project.
column7: The next step after approved the change request by CCB is to update change log and Update the Plans and affected baselines before implementing the approved change request [PMBOK 6th edition, Page115]

column2: You are managing a project in which your team members all work in the same  location and have worked together on many projects. You have seniors and junior team members. Senior team members feel that they are always overloaded and junior team members are not learning that fast. As a Project manager, what should you do?
column3: Focus on decreasing sources of conflicts Team
column6: Recognition and Rewards throughout the project
column7: People are motivated when they feel they are valued in the organization and the rewards are given to they demonstrate this value. Most project team members are motivated by an opportunity to grow, accomplish, and apply their professional skills to meet new challenges. A good strategy for project managers is to give team recognition throughout the life cycle of the project rather than waiting until the project is completed. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 342]

column2: Project stakeholders are concerned that the project changes may have an unplanned impact on the business documents. They want to understand these changes before they occur. What should the project manager do?
column3: Update the change management plan to track and communicate change.
column4: Escalate all changes to key stakeholders to obtain agreement before implementation.
column5: Ensure that all potential changes are part of the risk mitigation plan.
column6: Review the project plan to handle upcoming change requests.
column7: The project stakeholders want to understand changes before they occur because of the change management plan is a part of the project management plan, so the project manager should review the project plan to handle upcoming change requests. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page115]

column2: The change control board (CCB) recently approved two change requests. 1st was a delay in activity on the critical path due to insufficient resources. 2nd was due to sending late communications to stakeholders. What should you do FIRST as a project manager?
column4: Hire additional resources to do both at the same time
column7: The project manager should ask the CCB for further clarifications/explanations to Ensure that changes are made in a timely manner and Ensure changes are implemented in sequence. The CCB may also review configuration management activities. The roles and responsibilities of these boards are clearly defined and agreed upon by the appropriate stakeholders and are documented in the change management plan. CCB decisions are documented and communicated to the stakeholders for information and follow-up actions. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 121]

column2: A project manager analyzed the project's communication requirements and decided that 15 out of the 30 stakeholders in the project would only need voicemail updates of certain information. This type of communication method is called:
column7: Voicemail is an example of Push communication. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 374]

column2: You are managing a houses project, your cost performance is not as planned and your Project is over budget. Therefore, you again estimate the cost of the project and find that you will require more funding to complete the project. This will require an update of the cost baseline. What will you do?
column7: If there is a change which requires an update to the cost baseline, you will raise It, get it approved, and then update the cost baseline. [The PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page: 113, 115].

column2: In Critical Project for your organization, Your project is behind schedule and over budget. Therefore, the Project Sponsor asks you if the team members may work on weekends. As a Project manager, what should you do to persuade the team members to work during their weekends?
column3: Ask the Management what should you do
column7: To persuade the team members to work in their weekends; You should Apply Recognition and Rewards System. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.341]

column2: You are a project manager to construct a new industries in a typhoon prone area and may impact the schedule and quality. As a project manager, what should you do?
column4: Perform Quantitative Risk Analysis, and plan risk response
column5: Develop the risk management plan and establish a management reserve
column6: Outsource the project and transfer the risk
column7: The best risk response strategy appropriate for this project, Outsource the project and transfer the risk to complete this work and shifting ownership of a threat to a third party to manage the risk and to bear the impact if the threat occurs. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443].

column2: A project team is staffed with experienced subject matter experts. The project is going well and there are no known quality issues. Team members believe that the quality control process is unnecessary for this project. What should the project manager do?
column3: Review the risk management plan to update risks.
column4: Create a cause and effect diagram to quantify impact.
column5: Remove the process from the quality management plan.
column6: Create a team culture that is committed to quality
column7: Although the project is going well and there are no known quality issues, but the quality management processes are necessary , It applies to all projects to Meet customer requirements and decrease the employee attrition, errors, or rework. SO the project manager should Create a team culture that is committed to quality. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 338].

column2: You are a project manager and have received an acceptance of project deliverables and held the lessons learned session. What should you do next to close the project?
column7: The project manager has received an acceptance of project deliverables and held the lessons learned session so the validate scope process and Conduct performance evaluation have finished. Release the resources is the next step after update OPA. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.121]

column2: The project manager reviews the issue log at the end of each day. One issue she recorded in the issue log stems from delays in the delivery of resources from a contracted supplier. What tool should the project manager use to determine if corrective action is necessary?
column7: The scenario suggests the Control Procurements process is underway. Audits are among the tools and techniques of this process and are typically used to evaluate a documented procedure to ensure the procedure is being carried out according to plan and analyzed for improvements. In this situation, an audit can be used to review the schedule for the delivery of material per the contract. The audit results inform the project manager whether changes need to be made to the schedule. If the seller is delinquent I in delivering the material, the audit results will also allow the project manager to determine what, if any, corrective action should be conducted. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 498].

column2: You are a project manager of a company and your project is currently in the execution phase. In your project there is an issue requires the execution of the contingency plan, which impacts the cost baseline. As a project manager, what should you do?
column5: Do nothing as this would cause changes to the baselines
column7: The execution of the contingency plan will impact the project schedule, so the next step is to Issue a change request. Change requests are processed for review and disposition through the Perform Integrated Change Control process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115]

column2: The project manager hired a team to check the quality, but the project manager cannot obtain stakeholder consensus on the team's composition. What selection criteria can the project manager present to influence consensus?
column3: Knowledge of stakeholder expectations, market landscape, and project scope statement.
column4: Knowledge of the product benchmark, business case and quality assurance.
column5: Knowledge of the stakeholder engagement plan, approval criteria and document specifications.
column6: Knowledge of customer requirements, organizational policies and industry standards and project metrics.
column7: Knowledge of customer requirements, organizational policies and industry standards and project metrics. [PMBOK 6th Page, 332]

column2: What should the project manager refer to evaluate the resources that assign by the project management office (PMO)?
column7: The resource management plan is the component of the project management plan that provides guidance on how project resources should be evaluated. categorized, allocated, managed, and released. The resource management plan include also the team performance assessment criteria. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 339].

column2: You are a project manager in an Manufacturing project. You and key stakeholders start conducting a project benefit analysis. Because of the solutions that have not been identified, an engineer from another department has informed you that there are affected systems. As a project manager, what should you do?
column4: Review the project benefit analysis to consider the additional impact
column6: Document the issue in the issue log
column7: The issue log is a project document used to identify and monitor issues that occur in the project. The issue log can be updated with any new issues found during the project and described in the scenario because of the solutions that have not been identified causing the system are affected. Making this choice the best answer to the question asked. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 298]

column2: You are responsible for leading the HR Project. The customer has requested a change in the scope which you have processed through a change request and it is approved from CCB, and the team members Updated the Scope and Schedule baselines to reflect the approved changes. What should you do next?
column3: Inform the sponsor about the approved change request
column6: Inform the impacted stakeholders about the approved change request
column7: After updating the impacted baselines, you should inform the stakeholders about the approved change request. Option ( Inform the sponsor about the approved change request ) is incorrect because the project sponsor is a part of The CCB and has information about the approved change. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115]

column2: You have identified a risk that will negatively affect your security project. You and your team have decided to use an older encryption technology because of the high risk associated with the new technology. What type of risk strategy are you using?
column7: The Project team avoid new technology because of the high risk associated. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443].

column2: A quality defect on project deliverables. In Which Category are these risks included?
column7: [PMBOK 6th edition. Page 406]

column2: The project manager works in risk management and creating a risk register. The risk register records details of all the risks identified at the beginning and during the life of the project. What tool or technique should the project manager use to generate a list of all possible project risks?
column7: Brainstorming is a data-gathering technique that can be used for identify risk process and The goal of brainstorming is to obtain a comprehensive list of individual project risks and sources of overall project risk. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 414]

column2: You are the project manager of a large IT project. During the implementation phase, you sign a contract to rent an additional server from a local company because of the possibility that the main server may fail due to constant, local-area electrical outages. As a project manager, what strategy are you using?
column7: In risk mitigation, the action is taken to reduce the probability of occurrence and/or impact of a threat. the project manager wants to reduce the probability and impact by renting the generator.[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443]

column2: As a project manager, you discover that the concrete's composition is incorrect. What document should the project manager reviews to verify the concrete's performance and quality requirements?
column7: The Procurement statement of work (SOW) Include, specifications, quantity desired, quality levels, performance data, period of performance, work location, and other requirements. The SOW describes the procurement item in sufficient detail to allow prospective sellers to determine if they are capable of providing the products, services, or results. Sufficient detail can vary based on the nature of the item, the needs of the buyer, or the expected contract form. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 477]

column2: You are is a project manager leading huge project with 100 million dollars. Various teams from different countries are involved in this project and the teams need to work cohesively and seamlessly for the success of the project. The task of one team member is highly dependent on that of other team members. Which of the following is important for the overall success of project integration?
column4: Adherence to professional code of conduct
column5: Detailed definition of the work packages
column7: The communication management plan is vital for the success of project integration. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377].

column2: Your project team works in two different cities across the country. The team has been struggling to perform effectively, morale is low and has a difficult time resolving problems. What would be the BEST team development technique to resolve this issue?
column7: Colocation involves placing many or all of the most active project team members in the same physical location to enhance their ability to perform as a team. Colocation strategies can include a team meeting room, common places to post schedules, and other conveniences that enhance communication and a sense of community.[PMBOK 6th edition, Page340 ]

column2: A multiphase project that has been executed with internal resources has reached a phase gate. The key project stakeholders want to determine if the phase has met its success criteria, and whether or not the project should progress to the next phase. In addition to the project management plan, which documents will be required?
column4: Lessons learned register and lessons learned repository
column7: The business documents and project charter are needed to determine whether or not the project should progress to the next phase. The project charter will provide the project's success criteria. The business documents include the business case and benefits management plan. The business case documents the business need and the cost-benefit analysis that justifies the project. The benefits management plan is used to measure whether the benefits of the project are being achieved as planned. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 21]

column2: As the project manager of a constructing hospitals project, you are determining the accuracy of the deliverables before closing a project. What process should be used to determine this and is an input to formalizing acceptance?
column7: Validate Scope is the process of formalizing acceptance of the completed project deliverables. The verified deliverables obtained from the Control Quality process are reviewed with the customer or sponsor to ensure they are completed satisfactorily and have received formal acceptance of the deliverables by the customer or sponsor. Verified deliverables is the key inputs of validate scope process and outputs of Control quality process.[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 164]

column2: You are managing a project to construct commercial buildings. During the project kick-off meeting, one project team members had a disagreement around whether to include a specific test within testing scenarios for the new product or not. As the project manager, what should you do?
column5: Ask each one of them to explain the logic behind his opinion
column6: Postpone the discussion for a later time
column7: If you were to "Add the suggested scenario" (answer option a.), or "Reject adding the new test"(answer option b.) it will be a premature decision as you didn't discuss the reasoning behind both opinions, and since this is the project kick-off meeting and there's no time pressure for resolving the conflict "Postpone the discussion for later time" (answer option a.) seems an appealing approach, if you were to "Ask each one of them to explain the logic behind his opinion (answer option d.) it won't be the right time for such discussion. The best course of action is to "Postpone the discussion for a later time" (option c.). [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 349].

column2: Tom is the project manager of a project that is halfway through its execution. Jack realizes that the scope of the project should be changed due to a new government regulation affects the current project. What tool or technique should the project manager have considered before this issue occurred?
column7: Stakeholder analysis is the tool and technique in identify stakeholder process to know their requirements, expectations, the potential for influencing project outcomes, and the phase of the project life cycle where the stakeholder has the most influence or impact. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 512]

column2: You are working on a project to construct villa in your city, and you are about to start project planning. As a starting point for initial project planning, what is the first thing you should do?
column3: Conduct a project kick-off meeting to inform and engage stakeholders and gain commitment.
column4: Begin the process of identifying stakeholders so they can be engaged as necessary for project planning.
column5: Develop the project schedule to manage timely completion of the project
column6: Review the project charter to understand the high-level information about the project.
column7: The question states that project planning is about to begin which suggests that project initiation has been completed. The project charter is created during the Develop Project Charter process as part of project initiation. The project team uses the project charter as a starting point for initial project planning. The type and amount of information in the project charter varies depending on the complexity of the project and the information known at the time of its creation. At a minimum, the project charter should define the high-level information about the project that will be elaborated in the various components of the project management plan. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 81].

column2: You are managing a large engineering project. Your project team works in two different industries across the city. You want to communicate the vision and inspire the project team to achieve high performance. Which of the following skills help the project manager?
column7: Successful projects require leaders with strong leadership skills. Leadership is the ability to lead a team and inspire them to do their jobs well. It encompasses a wide range of skills, abilities, and actions. Leadership is important through all phases of the project life cycle. There are multiple leadership theories defining leadership styles that should be used as needed for each situation or team. It is especially important to communicate the vision and inspire the project team to achieve high performance. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 350]

column2: You are the project manager of the HDM Project. Your project must be completed by September 10 and cannot exceed $12,000. $12,000 is an example of which one of the following?
column7: because the constraints are limitations placed upon the project that the project manager and team must work within. there are scope, schedule and cost constraints. (how much funding has been allocated). and the three constraints are commonly called the triple constraints. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 253]

column2: Situational Awareness is a key interpersonal skill for all effective project managers and means knowing what is going on around you and being able to quickly switch your focus. What another skill is often used in conjunction with Situational Awareness where you the project manager, have to be persuasive in expressing your point and position in order for your project team and stakeholders to react quickly to changing project priorities?
column7: Influencing is an interpersonal skill that involves awareness of, and consideration for, the various perspectives in any situation. It helps you gather relevant and critical information in order to address changing project priorities and resolve unexpected project challenges. It is often used in conjunction with the Situational Awareness interpersonal tool.. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 350]

column2: You has been assigned as a project manager, you are managing a software development project as a result of observation and conversation, you notice some of the team members need to improve their skills. What should you do FIRST?
column4: Schedule training sessions for the team member to optimize his performance.
column7: The Resource Management Plan include Training strategies and Methods for developing the project team. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 319]
